text:
This year has been a year of pleasant changes and a lot of positive changes were seen in Indian cinema as well. From crediting and uplifting writers who otherwise don't get the validation they deserve, 2018 was a year when #MeToo movement paved its way and many sexual predators were called out.
A lot of mainstream actors gave their two cents on the relevance and importance of the movement and SRK has always made his voice heard on such issues.
At a recent event, he again spoke about the #MeToo movement in India. The actor said,
Agencies
“Should respect the emotion of the women taking such a strong step in coming out, and being so brave, and help stop this from happening in our individual industries. The sad part of it is that you don’t know if it could be happening right under your nose."
SRK is one superstar who has always stood up for equality and feminism. He once said, “women are superior to men in many levels”. And now, he again insisted that “respect” is actually the key.

He has time and again shared his conversations with his kids and especially his sons AbRam and Aryan. SRK had once confessed that he has actually warned his eldest son Aryan Khan that disrespecting people is not okay. Well, no wonder he is called the King Khan of Bollywood.
title: SRK Shares His Thoughts On #MeToo Movement & Explains Why Women Should Be Respected
